settings.title: Ayoba-Yo
settings.tagline: It’s not just jerky. It’s Biltong South African Jerky.
settings.blurb: Naturally air dryed and grass fed South African high protein snacks made with ZERO SUGAR

settings.second-text-blurb: Ayoba-Yo is our family company that was founded in our kitchen a few years after we moved to the United States from South Africa. What started as a Saturday morning hobby between a father and his sons slowly marinated into a business. We created Ayoba-Yo to celebrate our roots and introduce America to our traditional South African style meats known as Biltong, Droewors, and Boerewors.

settings.third-text-blurb: A high protein snack made with the finest cuts of beef that are air-dried for over fourteen days, rather than cooked like regular jerky, resulting in a tender slice of beef with naturally explosive flavor without having any sugar or artificial ingredients.

We invite you to share your favorite recipes with us too. (We will always give credit to the person who shared the recipe with us.) Send us your favorite recipe.
settings.cta-blog-p: Get the latest and greatest Ayoba-Yo recipes

settings.meet-faq-p: Biltong is a South African snack that has zero sugar, is high in protein with delicious flavor, and has a texture combination that falls somewhere between jerky and prosciutto. The process is simple, yet delicate. We start with the best cuts of beef and spice it to perfection using an old family recipe, marinate it, and air dry it for over fourteen days. The results are tender slices of beef with a naturally explosive flavor. Just like our South African ancestors, we use no artificial ingredients and only clean, natural spices. It’s perfect for a quick bite or a post-workout snack.

Droëwors is an artisanal dried beef stick that is made with 100% beef and contains no sugar. Just like with our Biltong, we start with the best cuts of beef that are finely ground and spiced with coriander, cloves, salt and pepper. The mix is then carefully stuffed into a natural casing and hung to dry for over five days. The result is a delicious, high protein treat that makes the perfect road trip or adventure snack that can be eaten anywhere.

settings.meet-faq-h3: South African Sausage AKA Farmer’s Sausage
settings.meet-faq-p: Boerewors is a traditional South African Recipe Sausage that is made of Beef and Pork. The word translates from Afrikaans into English as "Farmers Sausage". Just like our ancestors, we use no artificial flavorings or preservatives, and no fillers. Boerewors' secret ingredient is coriander, which sets it apart from any other sausage and gives it the authentic South African taste. We also offer boerewors in Beef Only.

settings.meet-faq-h2: How is Biltong different from Jerky?
settings.meet-faq-h3: Biltong is like jerky but also differs is some very distinct ways:
settings.meet-faq-p:
• The most important difference with Biltong and jerky is the way they’re made. Making biltong is a two week-long process where the beef gets air-dried without any heat, compared to jerky which uses a dehydrator. The Biltong also has a variety of all-natural ingredients to not only enhance the flavor but help cure the meat.
  • Another unique difference between Biltong and jerky is the taste. Biltong, which isn’t smoked like traditional jerky, comes from the best cuts of beef while using traditional South African spices giving it a naturally flavorful taste.
  • The last difference between Biltong and jerky is the thickness of meat used when curing the meat. Biltong can be much thicker than jerky during the curing process making it take longer to make but giving it a much juicier taste.

• Slice and spice

    • Our biltong starts with the best cuts of beef that are sliced into long strips and spiced with our not-so-secret blend of spices (void of anything artificial) and soaked in a vinegar based marinate overnight.

  • Hang to Dry

    • The strips are removed from the marinate and hung to dry in an air-controlled room. The Biltong will dry here for over fourteen days!

  • Slice and package

    • We now have Biltong! The whole strips of biltong are removed from the drying room and carefully sliced and packaged into convenient sizes.

• Beef, Sea Salt, Coriander, Cayenne Pepper, Worcestershire Powder{salt, tomato, vinegar, tamarind, natural flavor, citric acid, onion}, Chili Powder{chili powder, paprika, cumin, pepper, oregano}, Pepper, Vinegar
  • Instead of complete list of ingredients use table matrix with product name as column and ingredient list as row. Use check or fill system. Use foundation 6 tables
  • Note: Review page via SEO and GA to see if page structure needs to be change from traditional Header structure to article html structure with MEET OUR MEAT as H2.

settings.question: How is Biltong made?
settings.answer: Very simply put, biltong is air-dried for over 14 days instead of being cooked for only 8 hours like traditional beef jerky. You can see the whole process by clicking here.

settings.question: Where can I find the nutritional values and ingredients of the products?
settings.answer: All of the nutritional values and ingredients are listed on our packaging but you can also see a summary of the information by clicking here.

settings.question: Is there a minimum order?
settings.answer: There is no minimum order. However, boerewors needs to be shipped overnight thus, it could be more economical to order more and save on shipping cost.

settings.question: How do you ship boerewors?
settings.answer: We ship frozen boerewors overnight in insulated containers with ice packs.

settings.question: How should I store my boerewors?
settings.answer: Boerewors should be stored in the freezer, or used within 10 days after defrosting.

settings.question: How do I defrost my boerewors?
settings.answer: The best way to defrost your boerewors is to put it in your refrigerator the day before you want to eat it. If you are in a hurry, you can leave it on the kitchen counter or if that is still too long, just put it unopened in a bowl of cold water.

settings.question: How do I cook my boerewors?
settings.answer: The best way is to cook the boerewors on a grill on medium heat. This will keep the inside moist. It can also be cooked in a pan on your stove top with a small amount of water.

settings.question: How do I know that the boerewors is cooked and ready?
settings.answer: The inside temperature should be 155 degrees F. You can also cut a piece and check the core (center) It should not be pink. Another way is to try and break the skin. If it breaks without a problem it is ready.

settings.question: What methods of payment are accepted?
settings.answer: We accept all credit cards (Visa, Master and American Express) as well as payment through PayPal.

settings.question: What is the shipping policy?
settings.answer: We try our best to mail out your shipment within 24 hours of order, except we prefer to ship boerewors Mondays through Wednesdays to avoid possible delays in delivery over the weekend.

settings.question: What is the return policy?
settings.answer: Our products can not be returned, HOWEVER: We do have a 100% satisfaction guarantee and will reimburse you if you are not entirely satisfied with your purchase for 20 days from date of order.
